sen.j: 天橋立（あまのはしだて）は、京都府宮津市の宮津湾にある景勝地である。
sen.e: Amanohashidate is a scenic spot in Miyazu Bay, near Miyazu City in Kyoto Prefecture.
Amanohashidate is a scenic spot in Miyazu Bay, near Miyazu City in Kyoto Prefecture.
Amanohashidate is a scenic spot in Miyazu Bay, near Miyazu City in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 天橋立は、約7,000本のマツ林が続く長さ3.2km（大天橋、小天橋）、幅20から付根が170mほどの砂嘴（さし）である（地学上では砂州）。
sen.e: Amanohashidate's 3.2km length (Daitenkyo, Shotenkyo) is lined with about 7,000 pine trees; it is a spit (geologically speaking, a sand bar) ranging in width 20m to 170m at its base.
Amanohashidate is a sand spit (geologically, a sand bar) 3.2km long (Daitenkyo, Shotenkyo), lined with about 7,000 pine trees, and ranging in width from 20m to 170m at its base.
sen.cmt: 所有格をはずした。順番を少し入れ替えてわかりやすくした。
sen.e: Amanohashidate is a sand spit (geologically, a sand bar) 3.2km long (Daitenkyo, Shotenkyo), lined with about 7,000 pine trees, and ranging in width from 20m to 170m at its base.

sen.j: 宮津湾から阿蘇海を作る。
sen.e: It stretches from Miyazu Bay to the Aso Sea.
It stretches from Miyazu Bay to the Aso Sea.
It stretches from Miyazu Bay to the Aso Sea.

sen.j: 阿蘇海からは、文珠切戸（もんじゅのきりど）と文珠水路（もんじゅのすいろ）によって、宮津湾へ開く。
sen.e: Miyazu Bay opensinto the Aso Sea via Monju-no-kirido and Monju-no-suiro.
Miyazu Bay opens into the Aso Sea via Monju-no-kirido and Monju-no-suiro.
sen.cmt: opens と into の間にスペースを入れた。
sen.e: Miyazu Bay opens into the Aso Sea via Monju-no-kirido and Monju-no-suiro.

sen.j: また、一般にはそれを展望する傘松公園も含めた総称とする場合もある。
sen.e: The name can also refer to the area including Kasamatsu Park, which has a view of Amanohashidate.
The name can also refer to the area including Kasamatsu Park, which has a view of Amanohashidate.
The name can also refer to the area including Kasamatsu Park, which has a view of Amanohashidate.

sen.j: 大橋立と小橋立は可動橋で結ばれ（右写真手前の陸と砂嘴の間）、その下を遊覧船など小型船が通る。
sen.e: Ohashidate and Kohashidate are connected by a drawbridge (in the picture on the right, between the land in the foreground and the spit), below which tour boats and other small boats pass.
Daitenkyo and Shotenkyo are connected by a drawbridge (in the picture on the right, between the land in the foreground and the sand spit), below which tour boats and other small boats pass.
sen.cmt: 大天橋、小天橋、砂嘴を上の対訳・定訳に合わせた。
sen.e: Daitenkyo and Shotenkyo are connected by a drawbridge (in the picture on the right, between the land in the foreground and the sand spit), below which tour boats and other small boats pass.

sen.j: 人が逆さになって見ると、天に架かる橋のように見えることからこの名がついた。
sen.e: It got its name from the fact that if you look at it upside-down, it looks like a bridge across the sky.
It got its name from the fact that if you look at it upside-down, it looks like a bridge across the sky.
It got its name from the fact that if you look at it upside-down, it looks like a bridge across the sky.

sen.j: 北側の傘松公園から「股のぞき」で見るのが名称の由来でもあり、伝統的に美しいとされている（この傘松公園からの眺望は、「斜め一文字」とも呼ばれる）。
sen.e: The name came from people looking through their legs from Kasamatsu Park on the north side, a view that is traditionally considered very beautiful (the view from Kasamatsu Park is also called a "slanted number 1").
sen.cmt: the number 1 is written as a single, straight line in Japanese
sen.e: The name came from people looking through their legs from Kasamatsu Park on the north side, a view that is traditionally considered very beautiful (the view from Kasamatsu Park is also called a "slanted number 1").

The name came from people looking through their legs from Kasamatsu Park on the north side, a view that is traditionally considered very beautiful (the view from Kasamatsu Park is also called a "slanted number 1").

sen.j: 南側からの眺め（及びその展望台）である「飛龍観」（ひりゅうかん。
sen.e: The view from the south (and that vantage point), called "flying dragon" (Hiryukan.
The view from the south side (and that from vantage point), called "flying dragon" (Hiryukan.
sen.cmt: 側で side を加えた。展望台からの、でfrom を加えた。
sen.e: The view from the south side (and that from vantage point), called "flying dragon" (Hiryukan.

sen.j: 龍が天に登る姿に見えることから）も人気が高く、北側と観光客を二分するほどになっている。
sen.e: Because it looks like a dragon climbing into the sky), is also popular, drawing just as many tourists as the north side.
Because it looks like a dragon climbing into the sky), is also popular, drawing just as many tourists as the north side.
Because it looks like a dragon climbing into the sky), is also popular, drawing just as many tourists as the north side.

sen.j: その他にも展望台があり、東側からの眺めを「雪舟観」（せっしゅうかん。
sen.e: There are other vantage points: the one on the east is called Sesshukan (
There are other vantage points: the view from the east side is called Sesshukan (
sen.cmt: 側からの眺めで、view fromーーside。
sen.e: There are other vantage points: the view from the east side is called Sesshukan (

sen.j: 左に掲げた雪舟筆「天橋立図」が描かれたことから）、西からの眺めを「一字観」（いちじかん。
sen.e: from "Amanohashidate-zu" by Sesshu, shown at left); and the view from the west is called "Ichijikan" (
from "Amanohashidate-zu" by Sesshu, shown at left); and the view from the west is called "Ichijikan" (
from "Amanohashidate-zu" by Sesshu, shown at left); and the view from the west is called "Ichijikan" (

sen.j: 「一」の字に見えることから）という。
sen.e: Because it looks like the character for 1, or ichi).
Because it looks like the kanji character for 1, or ichi).
Because it looks like the kanji character for 1, or ichi).

sen.j: 古くから名所として知られており、一例として百人一首の小式部内侍の歌「大江山 いく野の道の 遠ければ まだふみもみず 天橋立」が見られるほか、丹後国風土記には、イザナギが天に昇るためのはしごが、イザナギが寝ている間に倒れて天橋立になったとの記述がある。
sen.e: Since it has been famous from ancient times, examples can be found in literature, such as the poem by KOSHIKIBU no Naishi in the Hyakunin-isshu, "By Mt. Oe the road to Ikuno is long, I have not yet seen Amanohashidate"; and in the Tango no Kuni Fudoki it is written that Izanagi had a ladder to climb to heaven, but it fell over while he was sleeping and became Amanohashidate.
sen.cmt: Hyakunin-isshu is a collection of 100 famous poems
sen.e: Since it has been famous from ancient times, examples can be found in literature, such as the poem by KOSHIKIBU no Naishi in the Hyakunin-isshu, "By Mt. Oe the road to Ikuno is long, I have not yet seen Amanohashidate"; and in the Tango no Kuni Fudoki it is written that Izanagi had a ladder to climb to heaven, but it fell over while he was sleeping and became Amanohashidate.

Since it has been famous from ancient times, examples can be found in literature, such as the poem by KOSHIKIBU no Naishi in the Hyakunin-isshu, "By Mt. Oe the road to Ikuno is long, I have not yet seen Amanohashidate"; and in the Tango no Kuni Fudoki it is written that Izanagi had a ladder to climb to heaven, but it fell over while he was sleeping and became Amanohashidate.

sen.j: 江戸時代から松島（現在の宮城県）、宮島（現在の広島県）とともに日本三景の一つに数えられた。
sen.e: Since the Edo period it has been counted as one of Japan's three scenic views, along with Matsushima (in present day Miyagi Prefecture) and Miyajima (in present day Hiroshima Prefecture).
Since the Edo period it has been counted as one of Japan's three scenic views, along with Matsushima (current Miyagi Prefecture) and Miyajima (current Hiroshima Prefecture).
Since the Edo period it has been counted as one of Japan's three scenic views, along with Matsushima (current Miyagi Prefecture) and Miyajima (current Hiroshima Prefecture).

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）11月22日に国の特別名勝に指定され、また日本の白砂青松100選にも指定されている。
sen.e: On November 22, 1952, it was given a special national designation, and has also been selected as one of the top 100 white sand beaches and green pine groves of Japan (Hakushaseisho Hyakusen).

On November 22, 1952, it was designated by the national government as a place of special scenic beauty, and has also been selected as one of the top 100 white sand beaches and green pine groves of Japan (Hakushaseisho Hyakusen).
sen.cmt: 国により特別名勝に指定された、という意味なのでわかりやすくしました。
sen.e: On November 22, 1952, it was designated by the national government as a place of special scenic beauty, and has also been selected as one of the top 100 white sand beaches and green pine groves of Japan (Hakushaseisho Hyakusen).

sen.j: 1955年6月1日には若狭湾国定公園の一部として国定公園に指定されていたが、2007年8月3日に丹後天橋立大江山国定公園として独立した。
sen.e: Although it was designated a part of the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park on June 1, 1955, it became its own Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park on August 3, 2007.
Although it was designated a part of the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park on June 1, 1955, it indepedently became Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park on August 3, 2007.
sen.cmt: 独立してーーになった、の部分を直した。
sen.e: Although it was designated a part of the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park on June 1, 1955, it indepedently became Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park on August 3, 2007.

sen.j: 2007年には日本の地質百選に選定された。
sen.e: In 2007 it was selected as one of Japan's top 100 geological features (Chishitsu Hyakusen).
In 2007 it was selected as one of Japan's top 100 geological features (Chishitsu Hyakusen).
In 2007 it was selected as one of Japan's top 100 geological features (Chishitsu Hyakusen).

sen.j: 京都府、宮津市などは「天橋立－日本の文化景観の原点」という名で、文化庁に対し世界遺産暫定一覧表記載資産候補としての提案をしている。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture and Miyazu City have suggested it to the Agency for Cultural Affairs as a candidate for the tentative World Heritage Site short list, calling it "Amanohashidate: The Origin of Japan's Cultural Scenery".

Kyoto Prefecture and Miyazu City have made suggestions to the Agency for Cultural Affairs as candidate for the tentative (UNESCO) World Heritage Site list, and named their suggestion "Amanohashidate: The Origin of Japan's Cultural Scenery".
sen.cmt: "it"があいまいだったのでわかりやすくした。
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture and Miyazu City have made suggestions to the Agency for Cultural Affairs as candidate for the tentative (UNESCO) World Heritage Site list, and named their suggestion "Amanohashidate: The Origin of Japan's Cultural Scenery".

sen.cmt: 社名を全部。東京便は 東京への便なので。

sen.j: コウノトリ但馬空港から全但バス空港連絡バスで豊岡駅 (兵庫県)へ。
sen.e: Zentan Bus Airport Shuttle from Kounotori Tajima Airport to Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture)
Zentan Bus Airport Shuttle from Kounotori Tajima Airport to Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture)
Zentan Bus Airport Shuttle from Kounotori Tajima Airport to Toyooka Station (Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: 同駅から北近畿タンゴ鉄道で天橋立駅下車。
sen.e: Take Kitakinki Tango Railway from there and get off at Amanohashidate Station.
Take Kitakinki Tango Railway from there and get off at Amanohashidate Station.
Take Kitakinki Tango Railway from there and get off at Amanohashidate Station.

sen.j: コウノトリ但馬空港（または豊岡市街）から車で約60分。
sen.e: About 60 minutes by car from Kounotori Tajima Airport (or downtown Toyooka)
About 60 minutes by car from Kounotori Tajima Airport (or from downtown Toyooka)
sen.cmt: 豊岡市街 からで from を加えた。
sen.e: About 60 minutes by car from Kounotori Tajima Airport (or from downtown Toyooka)

sen.e: Get off the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line at Amanohashidate Station.
Get off the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line at Amanohashidate Station.
Get off the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line at Amanohashidate Station.

sen.j: 京都駅からは、JRからの直通特急を利用して約2時間。
sen.e: About 2 hours from Kyoto Station via JR non-stop express
About 2 hours from Kyoto Station via JR non-stop express
About 2 hours from Kyoto Station via JR non-stop express

sen.j: 天橋立駅から天橋立の南端部へは徒歩すぐ。
sen.e: A short walk from Amanohashidate Station to the southern end of Amanohashidate
A short walk from Amanohashidate Station to the southern end of Amanohashidate
A short walk from Amanohashidate Station to the southern end of Amanohashidate

sen.j: 北側の傘松公園へは丹後海陸交通のバス・観光船などで一の宮へ行き徒歩で府中駅へ。
sen.e: To get to Kasamatsu Park on the north side, take the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Bus or Tour Boat to Ichinomiya and walk toward Fuchu Station.
To get to Kasamatsu Park on the north side, take the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Bus or Tour Boat to Ichinomiya and walk toward Fuchu Station.
To get to Kasamatsu Park on the north side, take the Tango Kairiku Kotsu Bus or Tour Boat to Ichinomiya and walk toward Fuchu Station.

sen.j: 同駅から天橋立鋼索鉄道に乗車、傘松駅から徒歩。
sen.e: From there, get on the Amanohashidate Cable Railway, and then walk from Kasamatsu Station.
From there, get on the Amanohashidate Cable Railway, and then walk from Kasamatsu Station.
From there, get on the Amanohashidate Cable Railway, and then walk from Kasamatsu Station.

sen.j: 天橋立は、近年、侵食により縮小・消滅の危機にある。
sen.e: Amanohashidate has shrunk in recent years due to erosion, and is in danger of disappearing.
Amanohashidate has shrunk in recent years due to erosion, and is in danger of disappearing.
Amanohashidate has shrunk in recent years due to erosion, and is in danger of disappearing.

sen.j: これは、戦後、河川にダムなどが作られ、山地から海への土砂供給量が減少し、天橋立における土砂の堆積・侵食バランスが崩れたためである。
sen.e: This is because dams were built on the river after the war, reducing the amount of sediment carried from the mountains to the sea, and destroying the balance of sediment deposits and erosion on Amanohashidate.

This is because dams were built on the rivers after the war, reducing the amount of sediment carried from the mountains to the sea, and destroying the balance of sediment deposits and erosion on Amanohashidate.
sen.cmt: river に s をつけました。
sen.e: This is because dams were built on the rivers after the war, reducing the amount of sediment carried from the mountains to the sea, and destroying the balance of sediment deposits and erosion on Amanohashidate.

sen.j: これ以上の侵食を防ぐため、行政では砂州上にそれと直交して小型の堆砂堤を多数設置し、流出する土砂をそこで食い止めようとしている（写真南側よりの眺め（飛龍観）の向かって右側の砂浜がノコギリ状になっている部分）。
sen.e: To prevent further erosion, the administration has installed many small erosion barriers on the sand bar in an attempt to stop the sand from washing away (in the picture from the south (Hiryukan), it is the part on the right where the beach has a saw-tooth shape).

To prevent further erosion, the administration has installed many small erosion barriers on the sand bar in an attempt to stop the sand from washing away (in the picture from the south (Hiryukan), it is the part on the right where the beach is serrated).

To prevent further erosion, the administration has installed many small erosion barriers on the sand bar in an attempt to stop the sand from washing away (in the picture from the south (Hiryukan), it is the part on the right where the beach is serrated).

sen.j: 松くい虫のため、一時松が立ち枯れし、全滅の危機に瀕した。
sen.e: At one time the trees were blighted by pine weevils, and were in danger of being wiped out.
At one time the trees were blighted by pine weevils, and were in danger of being wiped out.
At one time the trees were blighted by pine weevils, and were in danger of being wiped out.

sen.j: その後害虫駆除を行い現在では小康状態を保つ。
sen.e: Since then a pest eradication program has been implemented and the problem is currently in abatement.
Since then a pest eradication program has been implemented and the problem is currently in abatement.
Since then a pest eradication program has been implemented and the problem is currently in abatement.

sen.j: 天橋立物語 その文化と歴史と保全 - 岩垣雄一 著 （2007年7月、技報堂出版） ISBN 978-4-7655-1721-8
sen.e: The Story of Amanohashidate: Its Culture, History, and Preservation - Yuichi IWAGAKI (July 2007, Gihodo Shuppan) ISBN 978-4-7655-1721-8
